messages.title: A 'Living Wage' for all
messages.content: We think it’s unfair that responsible bankers go on earning huge salaries while a million UK children live in poverty. We think it’s unfair that the Government have failed to do anything about the growing gap between rich and poor.

messages.title: Protect our NHS
messages.content: We think it’s unfair that hospitals and health centres are treated like businesses rather than vital public services. We want to make sure no more public money is wasted on badly implemented privatisation schemes.

messages.title: Greens are ahead!
messages.content: Our green policies on climate change, renewable energy and recycling were established well before the main political parties had embraced these crucial issues. Greens now sit in the European Parliament, the Scottish Parliament, the London Assembly and on many local councils.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Green MPs will demand a 'Living Wage' to ensure low paid workers earn enough to provide for themselves and their families. They will fight for a fairer deal, with community banks, credit unions and mutuals providing realistic loans to families and small businesses.

Green MPs will press for a free insulation scheme for every single home as part of a green package to cut fuel bills and create a million new jobs. Green councillors have already pioneered such a scheme in Kirklees.

Green MPs will fight to make sure local services are easy to access and are truly local. We will provide cost savings across NHS administration within our NHS and protect the jobs of public sector workers.

issues.health: We think it’s unfair that hospitals and health centres are treated like businesses rather than vital public services. We want to make sure no more public money is wasted on badly implemented privatisation schemes.

housing.content: Bringing Britain's housing up to 'green' standards would create much-needed jobs for builders, plumbers, electricians and engineers.

endorsements.endorsement: Green Party leader and MEP Caroline Lucas receives the prestigious Parliament Magazine award as MEP of the Year 2008 for her work on trade.
